bestBHT.bht: Feeling surrounded and oppressed by an intense sorrow, Jesus found himself at the brink of despair, as he declared, My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death. The weight of this sorrow threatened to consume him entirely, leaving him on the verge of death. Recognizing the gravity of his predicament, he implored his disciples to tarry ye here, and watch, emphasizing the crucial importance of their presence and vigilance during this agonizing moment.

John Gill: My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death: he was surrounded with sorrow, and it pressed him so hard, and close, on every side, that he was just ready to die with it.
Tarry ye here, and watch: in Matthew it is added, 'with me'.

bhtAttempts.bht: Surrounded by an overwhelming sorrow, feeling as though he would die from it, Jesus expressed the depth of his anguish when he said, My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death. This sorrow pressed hard on every side, weighing heavily on his spirit. In his distress, he asked his disciples to stay with him and keep watch, emphasizing the need for their presence and support during this challenging time.

Feeling surrounded and oppressed by an intense sorrow, Jesus found himself at the brink of despair, as he declared, My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death. The weight of this sorrow threatened to consume him entirely, leaving him on the verge of death. Recognizing the gravity of his predicament, he implored his disciples to tarry ye here, and watch, emphasizing the crucial importance of their presence and vigilance during this agonizing moment.

In the face of immense sorrow, Jesus found himself in a state of utter despair, with the weight of his anguish pressing so heavily upon him that he felt as though he would die. His soul was overwhelmed by the intensity of this sorrow, leaving him in a state of distress. Recognizing the significance of the situation, he implored his disciples to remain with him and remain alert, emphasizing the importance of their companionship and watchfulness during this trying time.

As Jesus faced an unprecedented sorrow, he felt as though he was on the verge of death. The intensity of his despair weighed heavily on him, pressing from all sides. With the weight of impending doom, he exclaimed, My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death. Aware of the gravity of the situation, he pleaded with his disciples, Tarry ye here, and watch, emphasizing the need for their presence and attentiveness during this overwhelming moment.

My soul is exceeding sorrowful unto death: Jesus expressed the profound anguish he experienced, feeling as though this sorrow would consume him entirely. It pressed him from all sides, causing him immense distress and the feeling of being at the edge of death. In his vulnerability, he sought the support of his disciples, asking them to remain and keep watch, highlighting the significance of their presence during this distressing time.
